protocol_name: Confocal Microscopy imaging for Opaline Silica Single Cell Skeletons (Polycystines Radiolaria)
protocol_name_html: Confocal Microscopy imaging for Opaline Silica Single Cell Skeletons (Polycystines Radiolaria)
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"33vf6","text":"After DNA extraction, recover skeleton from the eluted pellet under binoculars or inverted microscope. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":103,"style":"align-justify"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ns9o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ee1t","text":"Note: During DNA extraction: dilute waste from the extraction procedure (i.e. pellet debris, containing the skeleton) in milliQ water and store skeletons at -20\u00b0C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":163,"style":"align-justify"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"39CF0280C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","id":669745,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Recovering skeletons"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eppvq","text":"Rinse skeleton several times in milli-Q water to decrease the concentration of SDS and other lysis and DNA precipitation reagents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bpcs4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3dcqc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fceag","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"39F77210C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","id":669746,"previous_id":669745,"previous_guid":"39CF0280C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","section":"Rinsing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c2fph","text":"Transfer skeleton into 1.5 ml Eppendorf tubes containing 50 \u00b5l of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":86,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":88,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8joak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ft010","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3A0EF1B0C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","id":669747,"previous_id":669746,"previous_guid":"39F77210C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","section":"Cleaning"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eb15f","text":"Heat at 70\u00b0C for 10 min to remove residual organic matter. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"agj20","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"edd32","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3A8692B0C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","id":669748,"previous_id":669747,"previous_guid":"3A0EF1B0C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","section":"Cleaning"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a36q9","text":"Handpick skeleton under binoculars or inverted microscope and repeat several rinsing steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3AFA6320C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","id":669750,"previous_guid":"3AC26330C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","section":null}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0tnj","text":"Transferred into 1.5 ml Eppendorf tubes containing 25\u00b5l of fluorescent staining mix (Colin et al., 2017). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1sqb6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"707uu","text":"Colin, S., Coelho, L.P., Sunagawa, S., Bowler, C., Karsenti, E., Bork, P., Pepperkok, R., de Vargas, C., 2017. Quantitative 3D-imaging for cell biology and ecology of environmental microbial eukaryotes. Elife 6, 1\u201315. doi:10.7554\/eLife.26066","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3B360C90C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","id":669751,"previous_guid":"3AFA6320C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","section":"Staining"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e7cc0","text":"Let the tubes for two hours for skeleton staining at room temperature and dark conditions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3BAE22C0C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","id":669752,"previous_guid":"3B360C90C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","section":"Staining"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5skb7","text":"Add 1.5 ml of milli-Q water to dilute the dye.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3C15E540C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","id":669753,"previous_guid":"3BAE22C0C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","section":"Diluting"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fn3jr","text":"Handpick the skeleton and repeat 4-6 rinsing steps into milli-Q water to properly clean the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3CB0C5B0C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","id":669754,"previous_guid":"3C15E540C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","section":"Rinsing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"75hf2","text":"Transfer skeleton into a micro well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3D19C0B0C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","id":669755,"previous_guid":"3CB0C5B0C4B611E8AD9CF1D96BE26FE2","section":"Preparing for imaging"}
